content.description: Climb starts the same as project one but turns right and under the arete after a few face moves.  Stay on the over hang of the arete until the top-out.  I can only see this one having one star because of it's proximity to a wall that is at your back and the crazy hard to protect fall.  But the climbing looks like it could be quite good.. and hard!!
content.protection: Many spotters and pads.  Very dangerous fall and hard to spot!!!
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.  Take a left (west) for about 50 yards and look up to your right and you will see the Brothers Lookout lower tier.  This is where "The Wisdom Wall" is located.  Once you have got the lower tier spotted, just bush whack your way towards the lookout while staying slightly EAST of main terrace.  Continue past the first tier via a gully that is best accessed from the far EAST of The Brothers Formation.  Walk up the gully looking to your right and you will start to see the hidden jewels of the 2nd Tier.  Continue to the top of the gully past "The Left Brain Buttress."  Look up and to the NORTH and the alcove with be obvious.

content.description:
Climb the face and leaning corner right of "

Looking Up

."  Still very dirty.  Could be a nice if not dangerous line!!
content.protection: Many pads and spotters!!!  Dangerous fall potential.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.  Take a left (west) for about 50 yards and look up to your right and you will see the Brothers Lookout lower tier.  This is where "The Wisdom Wall" is located. content.description:
Start just right of "

Brain Child

" in a left-leaning crack.  Follow the crack up into a mean, right hand, finger lock.  Pull hard and power left (1st crimps still dirty, so be careful) into a small set of crimps.  Work these crimps to the lip of the head-wall.  Finish on better holds leading to the summit of the "Brothers Lookout."  Great climbing with a possibly very dangerous crux fall.  I took it by myself a few times and it was spooky and not recommended.  Enjoy.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter!!  All the falls in this alcove can be very dangerous.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.  Take a left (west) for about 50 yards and look up to your right and you will see the Brothers Lookout lower tier.  This is where "The Wisdom Wall" is located.  Once you have got the lower tier spotted, just bush whack your way towards the lookout while staying slightly EAST of main terrace.  Continue past the first tier via a gully that is best accessed from the far EAST of The Brothers Formation.  Walk up the gully looking to your right and you will start to see the hidden jewels of the 2nd Tier.  Continue to the top of the gully past "The Left Brain Buttress."  Look up and to the NORTH and the alcove with be obvious.

content.description: Climb the crimps on face left of "Lowercase Class."  Climb the crimps until your feet are up on the broken ledge.  Next, dyno with your right (spooky) to a nice jug.  Continue straight up on slopers and crimp rails to the summit.  Maybe two star climbing marred by a bad fall and a broken ledge but worth the effort.
content.protection: Many pads and spotters.  This fall could be bad.  I took one and it was spooky!!!
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa. content.description:
Climb the inside corner in the back of the alcove.  The line right off "

Brain Child

."  Once in the corner work your way out left for the exit and finish.  Fun corner with an odd traversing finish.

content.description:
Climb the line right of "

Lowercase Class

."  Start down low with your left in a 2-3 finger pocket stack.  Climb the brain-like features into a nice lay-back crack system.  Follow this system to the summit.  Great climbing with an ok landing.  I would still bring a spotter!!.  Fun warm-up as well.
content.location: From the 1st parking lot, take the Sisters trail until it meets up with the Ponderosa.
